question: Why does happy-coder's integrated ripgrep hang when Codex executes `rg -n nitter` on Linux?
hypothesis: The packaged ripgrep binaries might be macOS builds so Linux cannot execute them.
The postinstall unpack script could be skipping re-extraction because it only checks for file existence.
Codex might retry the command after ripgrep fails to start, appearing as if it is stuck.
answer: happy-coder ships macOS arm64 ripgrep binaries inside tools/unpacked. The postinstall script checks only for file existence, so on Linux it skips re-unpacking the correct archive and keeps the macOS Mach-O files. When Codex runs `rg -n nitter`, the bundled launcher loads ripgrep.node, which fails with `invalid ELF header`. The CLI keeps waiting/retrying, so the command appears to hang.
